node.title: Welcome back: Fortress Queensland ends as border thrown open to interstate arrivals
node.alt: A police border checkpoint at Coolangatta
node.description: Air and road routes to Queensland are now open to all interstate travellers who are double vaccinated against COVID-19, however, border checkpoints will remain in place and border passes will still be required.
node.content:
["Australians who have been locked out of Queensland for months because of COVID-19 restrictions will be allowed back into the Sunshine State from today, regardless of whether or not they are coming from a designated hotspot.", "Air and road routes have now reopened to interstate travellers and returning Queenslanders from COVID-19 hotspots who meet these entry requirements:", "
Border checkpoints still in place
", "Unvaccinated travellers are still only allowed to arrive by air\u00a0and must complete 14 days of hotel quarantine.", "Border passes became live online on Sunday night, with different categories for border residents, interstate visitors and international travellers.", "Queensland police are\u00a0predicting\u00a0lengthy delays at border checkpoints on the Gold Coast and have anticipated up to 50,000 vehicles could pass through in the first 24 hours after the reopening of the road border.", "Police Commissioner Katarina Carroll asked motorists to \"pack their patience\" and warned authorities would be conducting compliance checks on vehicle occupants at all times of the day and night.", "That could mean checkpoint officers stopping every car, or it could mean allowing traffic to flow more freely but stopping cars at random.", "Residents in several locations across the country have been shut out of Queensland for months, including millions of people in New South Wales and Victoria.", "The first flight from a designated hotspot is from Sydney to Brisbane, touching down at Brisbane Airport at 7:30am.", "A spokesperson for Brisbane Airport said airlines would\u00a0triple the number of flights between Brisbane and Sydney by the end of this week.", "Flights between Brisbane and Melbourne will likewise scale-up significantly.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
